channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Student Course Evaluations Now Open for Summer 2024 Sessions I, III
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 1, 2024 (all day) - Course evaluations are now open for this year’s Summer I and III sessions. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, the five schools, and their departments, so please complete evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Saturday, August 17.
item.author: Students

item.title: Study Abroad Applications Now Being Accepted for Spring 2025
item.description: The Office of International Programs’ application portal is now open to undergraduate students who wish to apply for spring 2025 study abroad. Deadlines, contact info, and application guidelines are available via the International Programs website.
item.author: Students

item.title: Student Fall ’24/Spring ’25 Parking Permits Available as of August 1
item.description: Student parking permits for the Fall ’24/Spring ’25 semesters will be available for sale beginning Thursday, August 1. Please note that first-year students are not allowed to have a vehicle on campus, and all other students must register and have a valid permit before parking on campus. For additional information, please contact the Parking office by phone at (518) 276-6616 or via email.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Session to Highlight Single Course Enrollment Options
item.description: Date: Wednesday, August 21, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., as he reviews the online graduate programs for working professionals and provides course enrollment options to make an immediate impact on one’s work. Participants can also explore courses for developing valuable skills that benefit employee and employer alike.
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Physicist Moussa N’Gom Using Light to Enhance Nuclear Security
item.description: Our nation’s security depends on the effective detection of nuclear materials at our borders and beyond. To address this challenge, Rensselaer physicist Moussa N’Gom, Ph.D., is leading research aimed at developing a quantum sensing probe to detect and characterize special nuclear materials precisely and without contact.

item.title: TLC Announces Fall 2024 Faculty/Staff Teaching and Learning Opportunities
item.description: The Teaching and Learning Collaboratory (TLC) has just announced the upcoming trainings for Rensselaer faculty and staff for the Fall 2024 term. Please be sure to visit TLC’s training page for a list of upcoming sessions, as well as their dates, times, formats, and registration links.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Faculty Opportunity, “Planning for Student Success,” Scheduled for August 20
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, August 20, 2024 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM - Faculty will have an opportunity to attend their choice of help sessions to get support and assistance in developing their courses, with time to put their syllabus into HelioCampus, the required Institute assessment platform. Topics relevant to course design will also be addressed. These sessions are sponsored by the Office of Institutional Research and Assessment, and all faculty are welcome.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
